sentence.text: Bartter syndrome type IV, characterized by salt-losing nephropathies and sensorineural deafness, is caused by mutations of BSND or simultaneous mutations of both CLCNKA and CLCNKB.
GJB2 is the primary causative gene for non-syndromic sensorineural deafness and associated with several syndromic sensorineural deafness.
Our results indicated that the homozygous mutation c.22C AAAA T was the key genetic reason for the proband, and a digenic effect of BSND and GJB2 might contributed to sensorineural deafness.
